intro: Phlegmariurus cruentus, commonly known as the red-stemmed clubmoss, is a species of vascular plant belonging to the family Lycopodiaceae. It is a small, herbaceous plant characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, scale-like leaves. The plant is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky outcrops. Its spore-producing structures, called strobili, are clustered at the tips of the branches. Phlegmariurus cruentus plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
